title: 110_hr1589
content: The Act titled "Military Surviving Spouses Equity Act" repeals the offset of Dependency and Indemnity Compensation from Survivor Benefit Plan surviving spouse annuities. The "Military Surviving Spouses Equity Act" repeals certain sections of title 10, United States Code related to Survivor Benefit Plan annuities. Surviving spouses receiving SBP annuities before the effective date of the amendments must repay previously refunded amounts. Repayment details are specified in the Act. The "Military Surviving Spouses Equity Act" requires surviving spouses receiving SBP annuities to repay refunded amounts based on life expectancy ratio. The Secretary of Defense can waive repayment in cases of hardship or if not in the best interests of the United States. The "Military Surviving Spouses Equity Act" defines SBP annuity and SBP retired pay refund. It also repeals optional annuity authority under section 1448 of title 10, United States Code. The "Military Surviving Spouses Equity Act" addresses the payment of annuities to dependent children when there is no eligible surviving spouse. It also includes the restoration of eligibility for previously eligible surviving spouses to receive an annuity under subchapter II of chapter 73 of title 10, United States Code. The "Military Surviving Spouses Equity Act" restores eligibility for previously eligible surviving spouses to receive annuities under specific conditions. The amendments made by this section will take effect on October 1, 2007, or the date of the enactment of this Act. The amendments made by the "Military Surviving Spouses Equity Act" will apply to annuity payments under specific conditions starting on the effective date of the enactment of the Act.
